name: enteron
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the digestive tract (= the tube-like passage from the mouth, through the stomach and to the anus, through which food travels during digestion), especially of an embryo (= an animal that is developing either inside its mother or in an egg) or in a type of simple sea creature called a coelenterate: The opening into the enteron is guarded by a strong muscle called the sphincter. He measured the length of the entera in 35 adults. Synonyms
alimentary canal
digestive tract
More examplesFewer examplesYou can see the mouth opening into the enteron under a microscope.These fibres are responsible for the movement of the worms within the host enteron.The study is looking at the establishment of flora in the enteron of newborn babies.There have been changes of bacteria in the enteron of these fish.
